Here's a render of a project i'm working on.

the project name is "singleplayer"

It's meant to grasp at how full a minecraft world is, but at the same time how empty and desolate it is.

Don't expect it any time soon, probably sometime around christmas.... or something..

I tired to render a scene when I ended up getting...

Fishbowl Kerman

Have you figured that one out? and is it blender you are using?
Sorry I've been away I thought this thread went to bust like the others but nice to see people still active here

Have you figured that one out? and is it blender you are using?

very simple solution, Just set your index of refraction (IOR) to 1.0 light will travel straight through it rather than being refracted at 1.6,

Let's see.... what to say, what to say...

Hey guys! sorry i haven't been posting lately, but when i post things i sometimes give away important parts of an upcoming animation project...

HOPEFULLY i can get some kerbal animation thing out soon.

hopefully I have covered enough to not be to offensive.

I have a slight bit problem with rendering.I am currently making a trailer for my KSP series "USSK" which will be arriving when I get my new comp.

Its ment to have this scene ( The clouds have transparency for the ocean to be seen )

But when rendered

Tried everything I could,sun lamp,render layer but just cant get it right

Well, try taking things away by moving them to another layer.

Like if the clouds are causing it, try moving the clouds to layer two, then try a render.
'Roid Rage

'Roid Rage

EPIC!!

Well, try taking things away by moving them to another layer.

Like if the clouds are causing it, try moving the clouds to layer two, then try a render.

Found the problem to be my particle hair emitter but I'm having render artifacts now * Triangle black or grey shapes

Image of full render * Took me 42 Hours D:

EPIC!!

Found the problem to be my particle hair emitter but I'm having render artifacts now * Triangle black or grey shapes

Image of full render * Took me 42 Hours D:

<img snips>

If you're getting artifacts, try going over it in edit mode, select the whole things and do the "remove doubles" feature.

Check modifiers, might be something there.

If all else fails, re-make the mesh.

If you're getting artifacts, try going over it in edit mode, select the whole things and do the "remove doubles" feature.

Check modifiers, might be something there.

If all else fails, re-make the mesh.

I'm gonna have to render another 42 hours ;(

I'm gonna have to render another 42 hours ;(

Well, if you're doing a test render, set the little slider under the resolution to "25" or something like that.

Also, turn of anti-ailiasing, along with lighting effects.

That should speed it up quite a bit.
How the heck would a scene like that take 42 hours to render? My asteroid scene didn't take a even a few minutes to render and it was more complex than what you have going on there.
